name: Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great city !! thoroughly enjoyed our short stay and will be back.
reviews.title: Great location in downtown

likes.disliked: — prices in the restaurant were steep. We ate elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a beautiful room with a nice view of downtown- Desk Help was outstanding at checkin- Concierge gave us a great recommendation within walking distance for dinnner (Azia) and the stay was outstanding- Very comfortable beds- quiet-
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: would definitely stay again of the opportunity presented itself.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Vancouver

reviews.text: I was a little nervous before our stay due to some of the less that complimentary reviews on the website but from the second we arrived we loved the Sutton Place.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The hotel’s biggest asset is undoubtedly the staff, who are all friendly, helpful and efficient at all levels – from the front desk staff to the concierge to housekeeping. In particular a mention to the ladies and gent in the Gerard bar, who provide excellent discreet service and have great memories – we visited on Saturday and then again late on Monday night and they remembered that I have mayonnaise with my fries and my husband likes malt vinegar. It really is the little touches like this that make the difference.
reviews.title: Old World charm

reviews.text: Booked a grand suite, but due to a flood before we arrived ended up in a luxury one-bedroom suite in the Residence. Unlike other reviewers had no complaints about the bed but the air-con unit on the balcony was noisy and we were near the elevator and had distant rumbling from this into the early hours. A minor irritation. But the suite was great, large and clean, and room-service breakfast (inclusive in our rate) was a treat every day. There are indeed some stairs to descend to get to the pool from the changing rooms but the pool itself was quiet and in a good state of maintenance.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.text: The Sunday Jazz Brunch was very tasty - but the saxophone I had anticipated did not materialize: electric guitar and piano-based group instead.
reviews.title: Classy, Traditional Hotel

reviews.text: Would definitely come again but would ask to be away from the elevator.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — It was right downtown, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see.
likes.disliked: — the price - although it was included in our pre-cruise package

reviews.text: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for 4 nights, whilst on a business trip to Vancouver
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.liked: — Beautiful suite in a great location

reviews.text: LOCATION
reviews.title: A decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Sutton Place. The service is excellent. The location is fantastic. I adore the ambiance and atmosphere. It's a classy hotel. However, the room was a little shabby. We booked a luxury room, but it was not quite that. When we arrived the furniture had a thin layer of dust on it and this remained for the 3 days we were there. We also have a room next to the lift. It was like sleeping in a bowling alley! But I don't care. I love this hotel and always will. I can forgive them the odd thing!
reviews.title: I love Sutton Place

reviews.text: This hotel can fool you when you first step out of the cab! You think it is grand and luxurious but it really isn't. They try to pull it off with the all the bells and whistles that they offer but when you get down to the nitty gritty you are better to stay somewhere else - like the Best Western.
reviews.title: Average hotel - nothing fabulous

reviews.text: This hotel makes too many mistakes, causes discomfort, isn't consistent, is located next to a BUSY NOISY fire station (yes 2-6 am loud sirens), and located between loud busy streets.
reviews.title: One of the best Hotels I ever stayed in

reviews.text: The location is centrally located downtown and the spa is about all they have going for them.
reviews.title: favourite hotel in Vancouver, excellent location

reviews.text: It is not a sparkling clean place. Hallways are banged up, walls in the rooms are nicked and furniture scratched. They allow animals of all shapes and sizes, which is wonderful for the pet traveler, however they need to invest in heavy duty cleaning machines to rid the rooms and hallways of dog stench. Maybe not all rooms have it, but I had a variety of rooms over several months for my stay and they all smelled.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.text: There are about four hotels in Vancouver I try to stay at when I go up on business. It usually comes down to who gives me the best rate for my days there.
reviews.title: Solid Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sutton Place is a marvelous place for business or pleasure travel. The location just off Robson St is great for shopping and it is close to some of the better restaurants too.
reviews.title: Clean, but the service was a terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very well appointed and the staff knows how to accommodate serious travelers. The concierge has pulled off some tough request for me.
reviews.title: A Darn Good Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Excellent service. It's uncommon in the States.

reviews.title: Comfort and Elegance
reviews.text: We picked the Sutton Place for a two night stay in Vancouver based on the reviews we found on tripadvisor and the location in the city. The photos seemed great so we booked two nights at a great rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found ourselves heading to Vancouver a night earlier than expected and called the hotel while on the road to see if they had any vacancy for that evening. They did, but at $100 more than what we paid. We noted to the front desk that we saw a 24hr. deal on their website for $70 cheaper and they told us we needed to book the room online—they would not reserve the room for us by phone at that rate. When we explained that we were on the road and this was difficult, and we were already booked for two evenings with them, they didn't seem to care. Their site reservation system turned out to not work on our mobile phones and we ended up staying at the Fairmont two blocks away instead. It didn't seem very courteous to not extend the web fare for already booked and expected guests, especially as this was mid-week (I could maybe understand if it was a busy weekend).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Few hotels can rival the elegance, European charm and hospitality of The Sutton Place Hotel. One of Vancouver's most beautiful boutique hotels, situated in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The spectacular setting allows guests to experience exceptional service and all the needed amenities within the cosmopolitan ambiance of the city set against a majestic backdrop of mountains and sea.
